content.content: Red and purple, slightly raised spots on the lower legs and buttocks, non-blanching and mildly tender.

content.caption: Rash distribution on the lower legs.

Skin Examination.interpretation: Findings consistent with non-blanching purpura indicative of possible small-vessel vasculitis.

findings.content: Mild tenderness in knees and ankles without swelling, redness, or warmth. Full range of motion is preserved.

Musculoskeletal Examination.interpretation: Tenderness without swelling suggests an inflammatory process, potentially linked to underlying vasculitis.

Abdominal Examination.purpose: Check for signs of abdominal pain

findings.content: Mild tenderness in the lower abdomen with no guarding or rebound tenderness.

Abdominal Examination.interpretation: Mild abdominal tenderness is noted; it could be associated with the systemic inflammatory condition.

Vitals Check.interpretation: Vital signs within normal limits, no signs of systemic distress.

Respiratory Examination.purpose: Evaluate respiratory function and find any abnormalities

findings.content: Clear lung fields, no wheezing or crackles.

Respiratory Examination.interpretation: No respiratory distress; lung examination normal.

findings.content: Alert and oriented, cranial nerves intact, no focal deficits.

Neurological Examination.interpretation: Neurological status appears normal without any signs of central or peripheral nervous system involvement.

findings.content: No conjunctival injection, pupils equal and reactive.

Ophthalmologic Examination.interpretation: No ocular signs to suggest systemic involvement or inflammatory changes.

Lymph Node Examination.interpretation: Lymphatic examination normal with no signs of systemic infection.

Oral Examination.purpose: Check oral mucosa and throat for abnormalities

findings.content: Oral mucosa moist, no lesions or signs of infection.

Oral Examination.interpretation: Oral examination does not reveal any significant findings related to the current symptoms.

Complete Blood Count (CBC).purpose: Evaluate blood cell counts and immune response
Complete Blood Count (CBC).interpretation: Mild increase in white blood cells; may indicate ongoing inflammatory process.

Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR).purpose: Assess inflammation level in the body

results.content: ESR is 25 mm/hr, elevated above normal range (0-20 mm/hr).

Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR).interpretation: Elevated ESR indicates presence of inflammation, supporting a diagnosis of vasculitis.

Urinalysis.purpose: Evaluate urinary tract and possible renal involvement

results.content: Shows small amounts of blood and protein in the urine.

Urinalysis.interpretation: Presence of blood and protein suggests possible renal involvement, common in vasculitis.

content.content: Histopathological examination indicates presence of IgA deposits in the dermis.

Skin Biopsy.interpretation: Presence of IgA deposits confirms diagnosis of Henoch-Schönlein Purpura.

Antinuclear Antibody (ANA) Test.interpretation: Negative result helps to rule out SLE as a differential diagnosis.

results.content: Allergy panel negative for common allergens.

Allergy Panel Testing.interpretation: No allergic reactions noted, supporting lack of drug-induced vasculitis.

Liver Function Tests (LFTs).interpretation: Liver function normal; no hepatic involvement.

Imaging (e.g., X-ray, CT scan).purpose: Rule out complications in the abdomen
Imaging (e.g., X-ray, CT scan).interpretation: Imaging studies clear; suggests no acute abdominal pathology.

Electrocardiogram (ECG).interpretation: Normal findings with no cardiac abnormalities detected.

Blood Culture.interpretation: No signs of bacteremia or active infection.
